properties.name: Abbots Ale House
properties.highest:
Having a pint at The Abbot's was a bit like jumping back in time, and in a totally pleasant way at that. It is so uncommon, nowadays, to be in the company of a couple dozen people where the use of mobile phones is practically unseen and the main medium of communication is speech, with the odd hearty laughter to boot. All of that in a setting of delightful decor.
This is all made easier - no doubt - by the beer served (excellent, with some remarkable specialty brews) and the publican's good humour.
It immediately felt like your local pub of old.
properties.lowest: Arrived here with friends a few days ago and all seemed fine. Then suddenly a customer confronted one member of our group and immediately started questioning him as to why he was "looking all over the bar" when clearly he was just taking in his surroundings. This customer/wannabe bouncer was acting in a bizarre borderline intimidatory manner and the staff there didn't bother intervening. It was early in the night so none of us were drunk at all so there was no excuse for this behaviour. I tried reaching out to the venue just to get an explanation but with no luck. It's a shame I have to leave this review as all others are very positive.

properties.name: Callanan's Bar
properties.highest: Callanan's Bar has to one of the best Murphy's and Beamish pubs in all of Cork City, if not the entire county. A couple of friends and I were walking along George's Quay one Friday evening in January of 2024 and as we passed we decided to pop in. There was a traditional music session happening that night so we only had standing room at the bar counter. You can soak up the atmosphere of this bar from anywhere inside and we had a wonderful evening with our friends in Callanan's! The Staff: The staff are very friendly here and the service is very quick. They like a bit of chat too and are a wealth of information if you get talking to them when its quiet. Layout: The layout of the bar is pretty simplistic. There is esentially just one main room with a little snug at the front on the right as you enter. There is a little room at the back of the bar however, it is very small and only has a few tables and chairs. The bar counter is located in the main room at the right hand side and the seating along with tables are mainly along left hand side of the room. The snug like all other snugs can only take 4 or 5 people but if you are lucky to get into it not only will you have your own seperate access to the bar but its probably the best place to sit in the bar in general. Decor: Callanan's is another one of Cork's old timey bars and it is decorated in such fashion too. The walls are lined with timber panelling and there are a couple of pictures dotted along the walls however, the decorating is kepth mostly plain and simple. There are no tvs in this bar which is nice as this bar is where people come for conversation and a few sociables! Pop Up Gaeltacht: I came here once in my college days as a few friends were Irish speakers and they had heard about the Pop Up Gaeltacht that was taking in Callanan's that particular night. It was a brilliant experience to talk and share stories with people who ranged from basic conversation to a fluent grasp of the Irish language and ever since then I have wanted to come back. I asked the bar man when I visited a few weeks ago if the Pop Up Gaeltacht was still going and sure enough it was being held that very night in another pub in Cork city. If you are interested check out PopUpGaeltacht on Instagram or Facebook. Location: Its located on the corner of Mary St. and George's Quay oppiste Parliament Bridge. Overall Opinion: I highly recommend stopping by Callanan's Bar for a pint of Murphy's and Beamish and the pints were flowing the night we were here. If Guinness is more your thing, they have bottles of Guinness that you can order. Apparently a warm bottle of Guinness is a thing so I must give it a try. I would give Callanan's Bar 8.5 out of 10!
properties.lowest: Absolutely disgusting place, horrible service, rude staff, definitely wouldn't recommend going to.

properties.name: Dennehy's Bar
properties.highest: Dennehy's Bar is a brilliant local pub in the middle of the city! The owners and staff are friendly, attentive and most of all welcoming! They have a lovely selection of beer on tap however, I came in for a pint of stout. They serve a delicious pint of Guinness here and I can't imagine that any of the other stouts would be any different! Layout: The layout of the bar is split into two rooms. The first room is in the front and surrounds the bar itself with some seating. The second room has more seating and is to the rear of the premises. There is a small amount of seating out front of the bar which is lovely on a nice sunny day to enjoy a cold drink. Decor: The pub is decorated with memorabilia from Cork City's history through maps and photographs of the people as well as little plaques with historic details, etc. There is an old fire place in the room to the back of the bar. It was the third of June when we visited and it was covered up so I am not sure if it is still in use. Maybe we'll visit again when the weather gets colder and see if the fire place is in use then! I didn't notice any tv other than an old antique tv. The feel of this is a bar is one of a place where people should come for conversation rather than come to watch tv! Overall Opinion: Dennehy's Bar is an old school bar with a timely feel to it! Things feel like they move a little slower here and its wonderful! I highly recommend stopping by Dennehy's Bar for a beautiful pint of Guinness or drink of your choosing and have a good auld chat with friends!

You won't be disappointed. It's a unique and delightful addition to your dining experience.

One of my friends had to leave in another half an hour‚Äôs time and asked if she reordered now would the food be with us in time. She was told probably not, so she cancelled her food order and asked were there any items on the menu that would maybe come quicker - the waitress suggested toast, so she ordered that. After this we waited another 20 minutes just for the reordered coffees, and when they arrived mine was spilled all over the saucer, and one was missing, we had to ask for it again, and a further 2 times just for water for the table which we‚Äôd asked for in our original order and our reorder. The brunches arrived a full HOUR after we sat down, again not everything was brought out together and one friend was waiting even longer. The ‚Äúquick‚Äù toast arrived AFTER the brunches, and my friend had to leave before getting to eat it. The waitress apologised saying ‚Äúthe kitchen is very small‚Äù ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è and gave us the coffees on the house which was a nice gesture but not enough really considering the appalling service. properties.name: Homer Bar
properties.highest:
THE HOMER BAR, Cork

Chanced upon this lovely place!  A real Irish Bar with a warm atmosphere bustling with banter between the locals!  I was initially attracted by the name Homer thinking it has to do with the classical historian.  Being Greek that tweaked my curiosity so I walked in to the sound of Abba playing on the tele.  I then realized the name has more to do with a type of pigeon which like the customers here, always return!  It is a grand place, charming and with a character all its own!  If you‚Äôre lucky enough to be there during the day, you‚Äôll have the privilege of meeting Esther the bar lady who is one of the most welcoming lady you can meet.  Even though you‚Äôre a passer by, she‚Äôll make you feel at home! Exactly what you would expect from a real Irish Pub - warmth, laughter and Irish hospitality!  I highly recommend it !  The people, as everywhere in Ireland are warm and jovial and welcoming!  You are also very close to the Clock of Four Faces which is also referred to as the The Four Liars because of the fact that each face has a clock which has a mind of its own!  They‚Äôre close but never in sync !  I would say the closest you could get to time travel while enjoying a pint of your favourite brew!
properties.lowest: Seldom go in there and don't know much about the place

The room was clean , warm and bed was very comfortable.  Perfect for weekend City Break. Fantastic location the city is on your doorstep. We will be back, soon!  A special highlight was the Coconut Dessert we had , sublime!!
properties.lowest: Unfortunately I did not enjoy my stay. Service was poor, information was wrong - seems like a scam. The pool is not accessible. You need to pay 20‚Ç¨ per hour and book a long time in advance. Also restaurants and Caf√©s need precooking. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable. Only the Portiers are friendly. Very very poor Internet connection. You definitely loose WiFi connection with every step through the hallway. Also the rooms are old, dusty, rusty and full of mold. We had heavy rain, I confirm, but it was literally dripping in the hallway. Shame that it is extremely overpriced at the same time. PHOTOS ON REQUEST

Always a nice atmosphere, clean and brightly lit, very polite staff and lovely Guinness and Beamish stout üëçüèªüëçüèª
properties.lowest:
Was treated like I was very drunk last night, felt very targeted and unreasonable considering I only had 2 drinks, wasn't acting the bollox, and I was socially aware. Lady came up to me to ask for ID although I was not ordering a drink, and told me she's not going to serve me, even though I am 21. She had no reason not to serve me or treat me like a drunk. I will happily take my business elsewhere and proceeded to do so last night. Appalling treatment.

properties.name: SALT food & wine
properties.highest: Had a fantastic brunch here with family. Staff were all super friendly and we managed to park outside which was helpful because of the buggy. BLT with egg and wedges on the side, perfection! Will have to come in here during a week day!
properties.lowest:
The one star is for the staff & vibe of the place - both wonderful! Really sound staff and the interior design is lovely.

The food on the other hand... left a lot to be desired.
My girlfriend and I ordered eggs benedicts but what we got had a bunch of ingredients that were NOT listed on the menu!
There were chunks of carrot in with the pulled ham, and I also found a single piece of sweetcorn in mine?
My girlfriend's had a big chunk of star anise in hers??? Just bizarre more than anything and really didn't taste good.
I think if you're going to be adding ingredients that drastically impact the flavour of a dish that's tried and true like an eggs benedict, you need to be upfront about that to your customers so that they know this ain't like the one mom used to make. Call me crazy but I didn't order an eggs benedict expecting carrots and star anise in it, and had it been listed on the menu I simply wouldn't have ordered it and got something else!

Really a shame because this was a place the both of us had heard a lot of buzz about online and we were always wanting to try it. Don't think we'll be in any hurry back, not when there's ample places in the city that do a decent egg.

Anyway good luck and God bless ye I hope whoever reads this doesn't order the Benny.

edit: I read your comment and I appreciate that, and I really respect that you guys are putting your own fresh spin on the dish. But I do think it would be worth listing the ingredients that you said in your comment on the actual menu, especially for people with allergies - all I'm saying is I wouldn't expect to ask if there was star anise, carrots etc in an 'eggs benedict'. It's different enough from the norm that I feel as a customer I'd have liked to have known before I ordered it that the dish was going to be so different.
Wishing ye all the best in the future!

properties.name: Sin √â
properties.highest:
If you want a real authentic Irish pub, this is a real gem. Packed with locals and often with live music, it‚Äôs populated enough by locals that tourists are in the minority but are also welcomed warmly and embraced by the patrons.

There‚Äôs a great range of drinks and - as you‚Äôd expect - the whiskeys are well worth exploring.

Overall, it was the live music that really made it. The place is so small it‚Äôs amazing that so many musicians could actually squeeze in, but they had the place rocking and having a great time.
properties.lowest: The reason for the poor rating is that my friend was threatened and intimated by a musician who was performing there for taking a video of his performance. properties.lowest: Unfortunately we are very disappointed with the services that we received in the restaurant. We went for family dinner on a Tuesday night and we arrived around 8pm. The male waiter (who seems to be the manager) took us to the table and took our order. Within the 15 mins, we were served with our appetisers, no drinks were brought to the table. Not even a glass of water. We understood that they might be short staffed so we didn‚Äôt make any complaints and finished the appetisers without any drinks. The manager finally brought us the drink at 8:30pm and took away the finished appetisers. We were left ignored from this point onwards. No mains were served to us yet no one were checking if we were okay. I walked up to the waitress who was standing by the entrance of the kitchen checking for our order at around 9pm. Again, we were waiting for further 15 mins without anyone getting back to us regarding the order. I ended up walking up to the kitchen area for the second time and spoke to a different waitress to get the bill. Someone brought two of our mains to the table at the same time without even apologising. At this point, we were all getting very frustrating as we‚Äôve been waiting for an hour since we placed the order. We decided just to pay for the appetisers and drinks and left the restaurant. Bear in mind that, the second waitress who brought us the bill highlighted the issue to the manager and he didn‚Äôt even bother approaching us! He seems to tell her just to give us the bill. We have been to the restaurant several times and always have good impressions. This has now changed and I can‚Äôt believe the LOW standard of services that we received considering the amount of money they charged. I would genuinely go for ZERO star if there‚Äôs an option for it.

properties.name: The Abbey Tavern
properties.highest:
The Abby Tavern is located near St Finbarrs Cathedral and over my many years in Cork I have passed by this pub and it was only last week I finally decided to stop by and call in, what a brilliant choice it was!
Steadily my list of favourite pubs in Cork is growning and The Abby Tavern certainly makes it onto my little list!
We called in around 7pm on a Saturday in Octpber and it was lovely and quiet! They were a couple of tables available and we were delighted to be able to sit down and take in the atmosphere.
The staff were very friendly and very quick service and they keep the premises spotless.
The staff had two open fires lit which really added to the romantic atmosphere and had the premises lovely and cosey!
They had a beautiful pint of Guinness and a lovely hot Whiskey with a slice of lemon and cloves! I finally split the infamous G on the Guiness however I did not take a picture so I guess it never happened hahaüôÉ
From what we could see you can order a pizza from the neighbours from "Oak Fire Pizza" which is really nice!
The bar is decorated with some interesting wall art and its worth a walk around to see it all!
The Abby Tavern is truely a hidden gem in the south side of Cork City which I think makes it really great! The crowd is nice and unlike some more modern bars there was no television! Just really great conversations happen all around which is a really Irish thing and I'm glad to see it alive and well!
Definitely stop by and have a few sociables and you won't be dissapointed!
properties.lowest: Myself and a group of friends attempted to have a drink after being drove in by the rain. We were refused for unknown reasons being told ‚Äúdon‚Äôt even embarrass yourselves by trying to come in here‚Äù. Not sure what the reason was but it was annoying all the same.

Sunny day, sat outside with our dog and bought two pints. No issues until half way through drinks when a  man, possibly the manager, just came over saying "No, no, no, no, no." He spoke to us in such a rude manner and pointed aggressively at a corner for us to sit in. Eventually he said no dogs are allowed. I actually have no issue at all with that. Could have been some signage but no matter. I do have an issue with being spoken to in such a rude way and being allowed to buy a drink before anyone "noticed". Our dog weighs 44kg. I didn't sneak him through the gates in a handbag. Left the drinks and went. As we left we could hear other people questioning the "manager" as to
why we had to leave and stating they had no issues with the dog

properties.name: The Crane Lane Theatre
properties.highest: Such a viby place!! Cocktails upstairs are unreal and the whole place is so nicely decorated! Even going to bathroom may take you ages, due to the antique decorations in the bathroom stalls!  Drinks are on the pricy side however, it's nice to go in and treat yourself!
properties.lowest:
Bouncers  need to change. The bouncer told me and my friend that we could not go in, we wondered why and asked if it‚Äôs busy, being friendly, he said no and he just told us that we just can‚Äôt go in . While letting everyone else in . Another security guard was confused to why he wouldn‚Äôt like us inside and he just came up with an excuse . That we are too drunk .We were just starting our night sober and decided to go visit our friend inside waiting for us.

I assume it was racism as me and the friend I was with are not white, They didn‚Äôt look at our white friends twice but looked at us cuz of our race I presume .

I will no longer be able to see my musician friends that play here . And I will let them know about this problem in Crane lane .

properties.name: The Flying Enterprise Lounge
properties.highest: Had a confirmation today. Couldn't fault a thing. Had 22 people for a meal. From start to finish everything was perfect. Denis was very helpful thanks for everything. Definitely be back.
properties.lowest:
too expensive,
the quality of the food is average and the portions are small.
not recommended!

properties.name: The Friary
properties.highest: My girlfriend and I happened to bumble in here on pub trivia night (Wednesday), which was great fun. The unique decor is cozy old tavern filtered through a teenage boy's bedroom, I'm glad i didn't encounter any crusty socks, but I'm not sure if I'd have been surprised if I did. Good selection of liquor as well as a fanatical devotion to the master thespian, Sir Nicolas Coppola. Great Craic!
properties.lowest: Antisocial discrimatory owner who does not at least say why...

properties.name: The Gables
properties.highest: Traditional Irish bar, welcoming for both locals and tourists. Barman very attentive and friendly, serving a full range of tasty stouts. Lucky to see free traditional Irish music on a Sunday night (think it‚Äôs on a weekly basis) - very entertaining and enjoyable. Highly recommended.
properties.lowest: Rude staff.

properties.name: The Gallows
properties.highest: Charming pub for a pint & a game of darts.Great outdoor sitting on a summer's day
properties.lowest:
I can understand someone being stressed, but to take out your anger on paying customers is far from tolerable. This is the kind of service you may end up getting here. The pints are fine but the atmosphere is one that can't abide with, thanks to whoever ran the bar last night.
Thanks for the drinks but I will never be spending my hard earned money in that rancid pothole you call a bar.

properties.name: The Gerald Griffin
properties.highest: A fantastic bar and good crack üëè üëå üëç ‚Ä¶

properties.name: The Idle Hour
properties.highest:
Decent locals bar in the docks area know as 'Jewtown'.
Friendly and first bar you encounter if you come along Kennedy Quay from the Marina Market.
You can see how all the new office blocks are built around this holdout.
properties.lowest: Lovely wee working man's pub. Unfortunately charging in excess of dublin city prices. My 1st time paying a 5e note for a pint of Guinness and no change.  Won't be  going back

properties.name: The Joshua Tree
properties.highest:
Walked here after work by chance. It is the perfect place to enjoy some irish drinks and relax!
The atmosphere is great, the setting is cosy and the staff very friendly.
Very impressed with the beer garden too.
We really enjoyed it and definetly we‚Äôll go back!
properties.lowest: Racist and xenophobic. They refused to serve my friend on account of his skin color.

properties.name: The Kerrymans Bar
properties.highest:
This is a fantastic pub - top quality stout to accompany a soup and sandwich lunch. Served with a friendly smile, it really warmed me up on a cold, wet lunchtime. Incredible value too.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

properties.name: The Linen Weaver - JD Weatherspoon
properties.highest:
One of the best pub in town and situated right in the heart of the city.
Great Location, Huge seating capacity, Mind blowing Food and amazing range of Drinks to select from . Overall a lovely experience with every penny spent totally worth.
properties.lowest: Was walking by, looked like a nice place, went inside, the rudness and ignorance of the staff was beyond me. I for sure, will, not be coming back here ever again, and whoever asks about this place will know the staff are horrible. I can only imagine with how much "love" they prepare products for you. Avoid.

properties.name: The Long Valley
properties.highest: Food is excellent, staff are very friendly, only came in for a takeaway but ended up staying for drinks aswell. Will definitely return.
properties.lowest: One star, because I can't give 0. No bathroom for a wheelchair user such as myself. This is 2023 folks.

properties.name: The Mutton Lane Inn
properties.highest: I loved this pub! Very traditional. Beers were just perfect and the atmosphere was great. Will come back in January!
properties.lowest: Don't know why this place is so popular. Awful bar staff, metallic tasting pints, and to top it all off its filthy, best avoided.

properties.name: The Old Town Whiskey Bar At Bodega
properties.highest: Made a very spontaneous visit to this location. Was lovely seating outside. amazing interior. High ceiling, wide range of drinks. Didn‚Äôt try the food on offer. Still worth a visit. Fantastic beer from the brewery across the streetüòÄ
properties.lowest: Far cry from what the website promised, menus are completely outdated on the website even tho you have to book through the website during Covid times. From the minute we walked in you could tell the reservation hadn't been honoured and something properly prepared, firstly a waiter was over eager to take the order, my friend had gone to the bathroom and hadn't even looked at the menu, then we were sat for another 20 minutes waiting for someone to take the order and when a waiter had come towards us to take the order he was called to another table that arrived after us by the Security guard, overall the staff look disinterested and lacking motivation... food wise the burgers were average at best, but the fries are pretty tasty..cocktails were sub standard compared to other places in the city.. it's also not the cleanest... wouldn't be rushing back in a hurry to be honest.

properties.name: The Oliver Plunket
properties.highest: Great place for a drink or food and highly recommend. it was crowded as it was a Saturday night, but the hostess Maria could not have been more welcoming or kind. She got us a table relatively quick, the food was amazing, and the ambience was great. There was live music. My only complaint was at the bar was slammed, but I suppose that goes with the territory on Saturday night. Highly recommend and would go back.
properties.lowest: Can‚Äôt believe how much the quality of food & service here has declined. Waited 45 mins for the food to come despite the fact that it wasn‚Äôt even that busy and didn‚Äôt get a sniff of an apology from the waitress. What makes it even worse is we both ordered Loaded Fries which surely should only take 10 mins? After waiting that long for the food it was obvious they had been microwaved and as you can see there was barely any toppings. Absolutely disgusting, I ate around 5 chips before I started gagging and I couldn‚Äôt eat any more as they were both soggy and raw on the inside. So disappointing, definitely won‚Äôt be returning.

properties.name: The Oval
properties.highest: Had a great evening here Saturday 13th April. We managed to get the snug area inside to the left of the entrance. Really liked the old school layout. Proper old style pub, busy, with a friendly crowd, good vibes. And not often I'm in an Irish boozer with 4 stouts on tap. Love the place, will be back again.
properties.lowest: Stay well away. Security from Glasgow and barman with a shkn head both assaulted me last friday night. No reason. Just wanted to be tough cowards. Im pressing charges today which is nice but my advice. Stay well away.

properties.name: The Oyster Tavern
properties.highest: Hidden gem next to the English market, not surprised it's been recommended and rated high score. Amazing environment with lovely food and drink offered. The oyster is fresh, served with lemon sorbet, which is interesting. Their cocktail menu is very innovative but also tasty. We went in and had a lovely afternoon. There was a live band there too.
properties.lowest: We had a Christmas dinner there. Their Christmas set menu has V next to some dishes not specifying if that's vegan or vegetarian. As I'm vegetarian and intolerant to dairy, this info would be helpful. Waiter had no clue when I asked about that what I was asking. Also there was one allergen listed next to some dishes (no.9), but they didn't explain what it was. I've ordered soup risking that there is cream in it, hoping I'll be ok. Of course it was creamy soup. Bread that came with it came without butter or spread. As main I've ordered vegetarian mushrooms wellington. This came with gravy. I asked what the gravy is made of, as I was suspicious, because it looked the same as the gravy my colleagues got with chicken or beef. Of course they put meat roast gravy with the vegetarian mushrooms wellington. They took it away from my plate, but never replaced it with any vegetarian option. So I had very dry wellington without any gravy or sauce, and it's needed for that kind of dish. Some deserts came to some of us and but no spoons, so we had to ask. Not the best experience. I'm definitely not going back there. They don't care about people's allergies or choices so much, that they don't even care if they poison you. Honestly this was my worst eating experience since I became vegetarian. The other places are at least trying, this place didn't give a s**t.

properties.name: The Park
properties.highest: Relaxed and cozy atmosphere. Staff is wonderful and always friendly. Seating indoors and outdoors. Trivia night on Tuesday evenings (best to check their instagram page). However, they don't serve food (I don't know if this changed since I've been there). Great location, so you can grab a pizza from nearby late at night, and there's a tesco express next to it.

properties.name: The Poor Relation
properties.highest: On St. Patrick's Day, we impulsively stepped into a nearby bar for a drink, not knowing what to expect. However, as soon as we walked in, we were taken aback by the lively music and the overall atmosphere of the place. The vibe was electric, and everyone seemed to be having a great time. The drinks were fantastic, and all in all, it turned out to be an unexpectedly amazing evening that we won't soon forget.
properties.lowest: I don't like leaving bad reviews but I couldn't get over just how bad the service was, here. The staff were rude to several in our party. Took wrong orders and accused my friends of screwing up their order. They were slow and uninterested in general and often rude. The pile of dirty glasses just kept growing on the bar with none of them taking the initiative to get them cleaned. We were only there as it was so close to our hotel. Not a bad bar, and I can see many had a much better experience but the night we were here there was no friendliness or even politeness from any of the 3 the staff.

properties.name: The Raven Bar
properties.highest: Nice Irish pub with kitchen, good beers, wines and dishes. Fish and chips ,fish tacos and chili beef tacos are really tasty. Nice place for a good dinner or just for drinking!
properties.lowest: If you go in for a few pints and they have no seats you can‚Äôt stand at bar ü§î ‚Ä¶

properties.name: The Residence Bar
properties.highest: Beautiful little Irish pub off the beaten track. It's worth a visit to get the feel of a local pub. This is real Ireland üíö
properties.lowest: Best pub in the Northside of Cork city.fast and friendly staff

properties.name: The Rob Roy
properties.highest: The service was brilliant and needless to say rocking Jerry was his usual self, rude, offensive, and great fun.He was absolutely rocking it.
properties.lowest: A baileys drink should be A 50 mil shot it's a double..yes you are robbing people   was there last night with 7 friends. We spent a good few euro but the man drinking baileys was getting robbed every round

properties.name: The Rock
properties.highest: Best run bar I know in Cork... Exceptional service.... Always a good welcome... unique blend of old and young, city and country punters. Great melting pot.... and a great spot to watch a match...
properties.lowest: Didn't like it.

properties.name: The Roundy
properties.highest:
It is a comfy bar, the atmosphere is really nice, the better beer is Happy Bunny, wich is an IPA beer. There isn‚Äôt food here.
Around 10pm a DJ plays.
properties.lowest: I was just buying a freezing cold homeless lady a coffee when I was accosted but a tall balding grey haired man. He was extraordinarily aggressive and threatened me by saying I should watch my back and watch myself in general. I'm not from Cork and that lady was kind enough to give me directions to where I needed to go. The man proceeded to throw the womans coffee on the floor and continued woth his threatening behavior. A 1pm in the day. Avoid this place like the plague. Rude, unprofessional, arrogant and extraordinarily discriminatory to homeless people. It takes a lot to shock me. But that place did. Have a lovely Day. T

properties.name: The Secret Garden
properties.highest: Can smoke cig inside the gaff, why is this only a 2.2 star rating is mental too me, the smell of smoke fills the air and people are dancing without no care, the bouncers watch as you sneak off to bog as you and your mates rack up massive slugs
properties.lowest: Do not go here, big guy with a beard and long hair tied into a masculine ponytail with a small man ego only to turn down people to let in his friends and then after letting them wait for an hour only to say ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not letting anyone else in only my regulars‚Äù. Guy should probably stop going to McDonalds while watching Roadhouse and start hitting the treadmill before he calls himself a bouncer. Terrible management, in need of a serious upgrade don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

properties.name: The Shelbourne Bar
properties.highest: **THE PLACE** to share the vibrant spirit of Cork Jazz Festival. The craic, that good Irish festive mood to enjoy life, good booze and friendship. That day we enjoyed the performance of Harry & Friends, a 40years performing local jazz band, Mary Connolly and other invitees. Go and taste a  pint of Guinness, you'll return!!!
properties.lowest:
I was a regular customer of the Shelbourne Bar until the 22nd of Sept when I was bared for no reason other than having words with another customer from Glounthaune who only goes in there twice a week. He is part of what I would call a click (who from what I could see are running the place into the ground). after that date in question I had a conversation on the 22nd I was barred for no reason other than my explanation above ! I'm dumbfounded to say the least but not all that surprised as a lot of people in this trade don't have either the personally or the skills to talk and communicate effectively with people anymore.
I have been dealing with people for over 40 years both in sales and marketing and in the service industry i.e bars/restaurants/shops and hotels and never witnessed anything like it in my life.
So to finish up I'm very upset with the owner Philip who was very vague and insulting to me and unclear as to why I was being barred but then maybe this business has changed totally ?

properties.name: The Thomond Bar
properties.highest: Great beer, AMAZING home-style food, lovely, friendly and engaging staff- would absolutely recommend!
properties.lowest: Normally I always come here for food but today i was with my 6 month old who was in a buggy, the lady inside said we can't stay here with the buggy as it would get in the way for other customers ( never gave us the chance to fold up the buggy and put it out of the way ) this was at 1 o clock lunch time not in the evening when kids aren't allowed in pubs . They had no signage up saying buggys aren't allowed inside nor did they have any signage up saying it's a kid free zone . I totally respect if it's a kid free establishment but I didn't see any signs saying this ....when you look up online it doesn't mention buggys or kids I would understand if it was after 5 pm in the evening but it was lunch time !!!

properties.name: The Tower Bar
properties.highest: Great bar, for a fine pint of stout or beer, telly to watch the rugby, very comfortable surroundings, very helpful staff & intriguing establishment with all the photos

properties.name: The Washington Inn
properties.highest:
Great hospitality

Wow where do we begin?!
We had a lovely warm welcome beside a cosy open fire. Great friendly and hospitable barman- he was well able for us on our hen day out!
Lovely authentic clean bar. Will visit again.
properties.lowest: Was dragged out of the pub by ‚ÄòBrian Goulding‚Äô for putting in contact lenses. Ended up poking my eye in the processes and has swollen up since. Told him all I was doing was putting in contacts and to look at the cctv, not the first time i‚Äôve heard of his unprofessionalism. This was on the 30/3/24 if cctv needs proof of this shocking treatment. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone

properties.name: The Welcome Inn
properties.highest: I came upon this place by accident but it is a treasure if you want to experience something out of an era long gone.  The atmosphere is inviting, friendly typical of Irish hospitality ! You are guaranteed to strike up an interesting conversation with the locals!  Sit down, relax have a nice pint of Irish stout or if you wish, even a shot of the most expensive whiskey!  Those bottles are high up on a shelf and some of them are marked not for sale! This is the only Day Pub left in Cork and is located at the beginning of Oliver Plunket St. on the side close to the Bus station at Parnel Place.  If you want to experience its unique and quaint atmosphere and meet genuinely interesting characters, this is definitely the place to visit!
properties.lowest:
Had to leave after one drink as we felt very uncomfortable sitting at the table beside a couple who really needed to get a room (and they weren't kids).
I visited the toilets before we left
& although they looked clean, there was a very strong smell of urine which is unusual for a ladies toilet. Wouldn't go back.

properties.name: The Woodford
properties.highest:
My boyfriend and I stumbled into an alleyway with colourful lights (back entrance), only to discover the coolest pub. I just have to commend the barman and waiter for the positivity and laughter they shared with us.
We loved the atmosphere of the place. It has a real "New Orleans" feel to it.
The music was just spot on, as were the Christmas decorations and the whole "vibe".
We will be coming back to try the food for sure. üòä
properties.lowest: Food was good but the experience was awful. We were sat by a door and had to keep our jackets on to keep warm. We asked to be moved but were told it wasn't possible. We were told it's a big open bar and was always cold. They then moved the people across from us as they complained. No satisfaction when we asked how someone else had been moved.

properties.name: The Woolshed Baa & Grill
properties.highest:
Good spot with comfortable atmosphere to visit during the day, and a great spot to catch an early football match. We lucked out by checking their Instagram story and managed to get a code for a free wings and pint of Heineken each worth about ‚Ç¨20 each - Worth checking out if you plan to stop in here just in case! Wings were lovely and the pint was a pint. üëç
It should be noted that this whole venue is 21+ ALL DAY on Saturday (also Friday I believe) but they make exceptions to families. We saw two 18 year old lads with IDs get turned away at around 2pm, while there were actual toddlers wandering around inside. Odd rule so plan ahead! Nice if you're older as it's a less messy atmosphere than some of the 18+ bars in the city on the weekend.
properties.lowest: Disappointed is an understatement. No Aussie affair. Was looking forward to a Carlton cold listed on the menu, or vb or Bundaberg rum. None available since covid according to the bar staff. So why the f is it on the menu? Or is it kept only for the Dublin pub? The staff were lovely, but NO AUSSIE BEVVIES or mixers available. Do I sound annoyed, YES I AM. Change your menu to reflect actual availability, it's been 2 years since covid.

properties.name: Thompsons Cork Restaurant And Brewery
properties.highest:
We had dinner here before a show in the Everyman.
We were lucky to be accommodated without a booking on a busy evening.
The menu is great and you can see the kitchen at work.
I had the buttermilk chicken burger which was delicious and I had the biscoff cheesecake which was excellent.
Service was great. Toilets were clean. ‚Ç¨60 for two mains, two desserts and two soft drinks. Highly recommended.
properties.lowest: Food was very disappointing.  We had fish, very soggy, chicken wings not great.  Overall very poof food, will not be returning

properties.name: Tom Barrys
properties.highest: The atmosphere is really nice and chill, staff are friendly and food was quick to be served. Pizza was excellent and really good value. Will defo visit again.
properties.lowest: Great pub but is completely let down by one rude staff member. The staff member in question was a bald man who I presume to be possibly a manager. While queuing for a drink at the bar, he screamed in my face that I had to move or wouldn‚Äôt be served. I was completely taken aback as I was not in anyone‚Äôs way and also was appalled at the way I was spoken to. I told the manager I had no problem moving if I was asked politely to which he screamed in my face again that I would not be served. I was standing in front of the entrance to the bar without seeing that there was a sign asking for that area to be kept clear so understand that I did need to move but the way in which I was asked to do so was completely unacceptable. Obviously an egotistical person on a power trip, I pity any staff under his management if this is how paying customers are spoken to. Hopefully this review will remind him that manners and respect are free. Lovely pub and great pizza but will be slow to return.

properties.name: Vicarstown Bar
properties.highest:
Really lovely bar, they have invested in it recently.
Great service from the bar staff on Saturday
The smoked nuts are also very good with drinks

They have lovely food now, tacos and nachos. Really tasty

Bar is wheelchair accessible. Indoor and outdoor seating available
Covered smoking area in the back area.
properties.lowest: Expensive for what it is, a late night haunt that is less busy than the other late pubs in the city. I paid ‚Ç¨6.60 for an awful pint of changeling.
